sentences.english: Roofless towers appeared and disappeared, thrusting blindly upward.
sentences.chinese: 无顶的塔不断显现又隐匿，盲目的直插云霄。

sentences.english: Overall, the students can not be blindly Starchaser.
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，中学生不能盲目追星。

sentences.english: Leadership Don't get blinded by the cult-hero worshiped "Big L" leaders;
sentences.chinese: 领导能力无须盲目崇拜“大人物”领导者。

sentences.english: So why, then, do we blindly follow experts?
sentences.chinese: 那么，为什么我们还盲目追崇专家呢？

sentences.english: An eye for eye only ends up making the whole world blind.
sentences.chinese: 以眼还眼只会让世界最终盲目。

sentences.english: Love is blind but marriage is an eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 爱情让人盲目，而婚姻则让人重获光明。

sentences.english: Gorged with power, I grew blind to Pokemon being alive.
sentences.chinese: 因贪嗜权力，竟令小生对神奇宝贝之存活盲目不见。

sentences.english: In addition, he turned the justice anti-invasion war into absurdly indiscriminate rejection of everything foreign.
sentences.chinese: 把正义的反侵略的爱国主义变成了荒谬的盲目排外。

sentences.english: They queered their Three-Year Plan by their premature advance.
sentences.chinese: 他们的盲目冒进使三年计划搞得一团糟。

sentences.english: Love is blind, but marriage is a real eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 爱是盲目的，但结婚是真正的明目剂。

sentences.english: The nation's cultural relics chief is opposed to the blind reconstruction of old city towns.
sentences.chinese: 国家文物局局长反对盲目改造旧城。

sentences.english: The studies also showed that love could be blind.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究还表明，爱情可能是盲目的。

sentences.english: The first one is parents’ blind pampering of children.
sentences.chinese: 第一个是父母对于孩子的盲目溺爱。

sentences.english: It is said the love is blind but friendship is clairvoyant.
sentences.chinese: 据说爱情令人盲目，而友谊却能让人醍醐灌顶。

sentences.english: Whithout practicing, theory will be blind.
sentences.chinese: 没有理论指导的实践是盲目的实践。

sentences.english: And again,don't take my word for it of course.

definition: to follow blindly/to conform slavishly/unthinking obedience
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
to avoid as taboo/to avoid by all means
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
to go with the tide/to blindly follow the crowd/to follow the trend
to follow the crowd/going with the tide
